GZB.name: Neurostimulator, Deep Brain
GZB.mri_concern: Active implant, metallic leads, RF heating risk

OLO.name: Spinal Cord Stimulator
OLO.mri_concern: Active implant, metallic leads, RF heating risk

MWN.name: Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD)
MWN.mri_concern: Active implant, metallic leads, RF heating risk

DSI.name: Pacemaker, Permanent Implantable
DSI.mri_concern: Active implant, metallic leads, RF heating risk

DXH.name: Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT) Device
DXH.mri_concern: Active implant, metallic leads, RF heating risk

MNH.name: Spinal Interlaminar Fixation Orthosis
MNH.mri_concern: Metallic screws and rods, displacement force

KWP.name: Hip Joint Metal/Polymer Semi-Constrained Prosthesis
KWP.mri_concern: Metallic femoral stem and acetabular shell

MAX.name: Knee Joint Patellar (Femoral) Metallic Resurfacing Prosthesis

MQP.name: Shoulder Joint Glenoid (Hemi-Shoulder) Metallic Cemented Prosthesis

FRO.name: Hydrogel Wound Dressing
FRO.mri_concern: May contain metallic components in combination products

Ti-6Al-4V.notes: Most common titanium alloy for implants, excellent MR compatibility

Titanium.notes: Commercially pure titanium (CP Ti), excellent MR compatibility

Stainless Steel 316L.notes: Requires careful testing, may have higher displacement forces

CoCr.notes: Cobalt-chromium alloy, commonly used in stents

Platinum-Iridium.notes: Used in neurostimulator and pacemaker leads

Nitinol.notes: Nickel-titanium shape memory alloy, common in stents and frames

MP35N.notes: Nickel-cobalt alloy, used in lead wires

PEEK.notes: Polyetheretherketone, radiolucent, no MRI safety concerns

UHMWPE.notes: Ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene, no MRI safety concerns

Silicone.notes: Medical-grade silicone, no MRI safety concerns

Ceramic.notes: Alumina or zirconia ceramic, no MRI safety concerns

3T.description: High-field clinical MRI scanner (requires additional testing)

rf_heating.test_method: Measurement of Radio Frequency Induced Heating Near Passive Implants During Magnetic Resonance Imaging
rf_heating.acceptance_criteria: Temperature rise ≤2°C for MR Conditional, <1°C for MR Safe (if applicable)
rf_heating.equipment_required: Fiber optic temperature probes, phantom, MRI scanner

displacement_force.test_method: Standard Test Method for Measurement of Magnetically Induced Displacement Force on Medical Devices in the Magnetic Resonance Environment
displacement_force.acceptance_criteria: Displacement force < device weight (for translational movement)
displacement_force.equipment_required: Deflection angle apparatus or force transducer

image_artifact.test_method: Standard Test Method for Evaluation of MR Image Artifacts from Passive Implants
image_artifact.acceptance_criteria: Artifact extent documented, typically ≤50mm radius from implant

torque.test_method: Standard Test Method for Measurement of Magnetically Induced Torque on Medical Devices in the Magnetic Resonance Environment
torque.acceptance_criteria: Torque < retention forces of fixation (for orthopedic implants)

fda_guidance.title: Establishing Safety and Compatibility of Passive Implants in the Magnetic Resonance (MR) Environment
key_recommendations: Use consensus standards (ASTM F2182, F2052, F2119, F2213)
Test at clinically relevant field strengths (1.5T and 3T minimum)
Document MR Conditional labeling conditions (field strength, SAR, scan duration)
Provide artifact characterization for diagnostic imaging impact
Include MRI safety information in labeling (IFU Section 7)

MR_SAFE.definition: Non-conducting, non-metallic, non-magnetic items that pose no known hazards in all MR environments
MR_SAFE.labeling: MR Safe - Safe for all MRI environments

MR_CONDITIONAL.definition: Items that have been demonstrated to pose no known hazards in a specified MR environment with specified conditions of use
MR_CONDITIONAL.testing_required: ASTM F2182, F2052, F2119 at relevant field strengths
MR_CONDITIONAL.labeling: MR Conditional - Safe under specified conditions (field strength, SAR limits, scan duration)

MR_UNSAFE.definition: Items that pose unacceptable risk to the patient or other individuals in the MR environment
MR_UNSAFE.testing_required: Displacement force > 3x device weight indicates unsafe
MR_UNSAFE.labeling: MR Unsafe - Do not expose to MRI
